verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. Hear<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>, O God<WH430>, in my complaint<WH7879>: Preserve<WH5341> my life<WH2416> from fear<WH6343> of the enemy<WH341>.
Hide <WH5641> me from the secret counsel<WH5475> of evil-doers<WH7489>, From the tumult<WH7285> of the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>;
Who have whet<WH8150> their tongue<WH3956> like a sword<WH2719>, And have aimed<WH1869> their arrows<WH2671>, even bitter<WH4751> words<WH1697>,
That they may shoot<WH3384> in secret<WH4565> places at the perfect<WH8535>: Suddenly<WH6597> do they shoot<WH3384> at him<WH3372>, and fear not.
They encourage<WH2388> themselves in an evil<WH7451> purpose<WH1697>; They commune<WH5608> of laying<WH2934> snares<WH4170> privily<WH2934>; They say<WH559>, Who will see them<WH7200>?

They search out<WH2664> iniquities<WH5766>; We have accomplished<WH8552>, say they<WH2664>, a diligent search<WH2665>: And the inward<WH7130> thought and the heart<WH3820> of every one<WH376> is deep<WH6013>.
But God<WH430> will shoot<WH3384> at them<WH2671>; With an arrow suddenly<WH6597> shall they be wounded<WH4347>.
So they shall be made to stumble<WH3782>, their own tongue<WH3956> being against them<WH7200>: All that see them shall wag the head<WH5074>.
And all men<WH120> shall fear<WH3372>; And they shall declare<WH5046> the work<WH6467> of God<WH430>, And shall wisely consider<WH7919> of his doing<WH4639>.
The righteous<WH6662> shall be glad<WH8055> in Jehovah<WH3068>, and shall take refuge<WH2620> in him<WH3477>; And all the upright in heart<WH3820> shall glory<WH1984>.
